titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lady Sundon, Letterbook
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:58
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: [Letterbook]

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Manuscript, in more than one hand, of a collection of about 315 copies of letters to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon. Almost all the letters in the first volume are from Sarah Churchill, the Duchess of Marlborough, regarding the Duchess' involvement in secret political affairs and intrigues, including those surrounding the son of James II, whom the Duchess calls "the Pretender." The first volume begins with "A list of Papers the Dutchess of Marlborough gave Mrs. Clayton to read, and beg'd they might lye in her custody, which they did for twelve months not careing to trust them in any other hand, and being afraid to keep them in her own house," and "The Cypher the Dutchess of Marlborough (when she went abroad) left with Mrs. Clayton to write to her by." The second volume contains letters, dated between 1722 and 1732, by various correspondents including Mary, Countess Cowper, the Duchess of Kent, the Countess of Pomfret, and the Countess of Pembroke, and are of a primarily social nature; topics include visits in town and Mrs. Clayton's health.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn fc110 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lady Sundon, Letterbook. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn fc110. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

controlaccess.persname: Marlborough, Sarah Jennings Churchill, Duchess of, 1660-1744

did.unittitle: OSBORN FC110
ANNE, QUEEN OF GT. BRIT., 1665-1714
Letter (copy) to Sophia, Electress of Hanover, consort of Ernest Augustus, Elector of Hanover (1630-1714)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
St. James
2 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Asks that she "contribute to the
security of the Succession".
110/I/91

did.unittitle: ANNE, QUEEN OF GT. BRIT., 1665-1714
Letter (copy) to George, king of Gt. Brit. and Elector of Hanover (1660-1727)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
St. James
2 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Warns him not to disrupt the
succession.
110/I/92

did.unittitle: [ANONYMOUS]
3 letters (copies) to Sarah (Jennings) Churchill, duchess of Marlborough (1660-1744)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Hanover
4 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Concerns the proceedings of the
Electoral Court and the death of
Sophia, Electress of Hanover,
consort of Ernest Augustus, Elector
of Hanover (1630-1714).
110/I/94-96

did.unittitle: BENSON, W.
Letter (copy) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Expression of gratitude.
110/II/314

did.unittitle: BURNET, GILBERT, 1690-1726
Letter (copy) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Sends his sermon and a copy for
Sarah (Jennings) Churchill, duchess
of Marlborough (1660-1744).
110/II/316

did.unittitle: CLARKE, SAMUEL, 1675-1729
Letter (copy) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Windsor
1 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Describes the health of Caroline,
queen consort of George II
(1683-1737).
110/II/271

did.unittitle: CLAYTON, ROBERT, BP. OF CLOGHER, 1695-1758
15 letters (copies) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1730 Apr 30 - 1732 Jun 25
Dublin
45 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Correspondence about books, church
politics, and Parliament; mentions
such figures as: John Perceval, 1st
earl of Egmont (1683-1748), and
Lionel Cranfield Sackville, 1st duke
of Dorset (1688-1765).
110/II/194-195,272-287

did.unittitle: COWPER, MARY (CLAVERING), 1ST COUNTESS COWPER, 1685-1724
23 letters (copies) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[1713] - 1722 Jun 21
various places
26 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Friendly correspondence about social
events, personal health, William
Cowper, 1st earl Cowper (d.1723),
Caroline, queen consort of George II
(1683-1737), John Churchill, 1st
duke of Marlborough (1650-1722), and
other public figures.
110/II/98-100,102-111,113-124

did.unittitle: COWPER, WILLIAM, 1ST EARL COWPER, D. 1723
2 letters (copies) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Colgreen
2 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
About the health of his wife, Mary
(Clavering) Cowper, Countess Cowper
(1685-1724).
110/11/101,112

Letter (copy) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Directions for Sarah (Jennings)
Churchill, duchess of Marlborough
(1660-1744).
110/I/3

did.unittitle: DERHAM, WILLIAM, 1657-1735
2 letters (copies) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1731 Oct 12 and 1731 Dec 14
Upminster
3 p.; 38 x 24 cm.

Caroline, queen consort of George II
(1683-1737).
110/II/312-313

10 letters (copies) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1728 Apr 7 - Dec 15
Pickill

110/II/199-208

did.unittitle: HOADLY, BENJAMIN, BP. OF WINCHESTER, 1676-1761
40 letters (copies) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1715 Aug 10 - 1732 Dec 27
various places
62 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Personal correspondence about court

110/II/125-156,191-193,196-198

did.unittitle: MARLBOROUGH, SARAH CHURCHILL, DUCHESS OF, 1660-1744
Letter (copy) to Anne, queen of Gt. Brit. (1665-1714)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Protesting her faithfulness to the
Queen out of whose favor she has
recently fallen.
110/I/88

did.unittitle: MARLBOROUGH, SARAH CHURCHILL, DUCHESS OF, 1660-1744
Letter (copy) to George I, king of Gt. Brit. (1660-1727)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
2 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Denies accusation that she or her
husband wrote a letter to James,
Prince of Wales, the Old Pretender
(1688-1766).
110/I/97

did.unittitle: MARLBOROUGH, SARAH CHURCHILL, DUCHESS OF, 1660-1744
Letter (copy) to Abigail (Hill) Masham, Lady Masham (d.1734)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
4 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Scathing denunciation of Lady Masham
at the time she became chief
confidant to Anne, queen of Gt. Brit.
(1665-1714); mentions Robert Harley,
1st earl of Oxford (1661-1724).
110/I/89

did.unittitle: MARLBOROUGH, SARAH CHURCHILL, DUCHESS OF, 1660-1744
86 letters (copies) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1713 Oct 15 - 1721 Jul 8
various places
203 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Personal correspondence to "my best
friend"; subjects range from politics
to clothes, friends to finance; most
letters were written from Europe
where the Marlboroughs were in exile
in 1713-1714; letters mention: John
Churchill, 1st duke of Marlborough
(1650-1722); Anne, queen of Gt. Brit.
(1665-1714); Henry Somerset, 2nd duke
of Somerset (1683-1757); James,
Prince of Wales, the Old Pretender
(1688-1766); Henry St. John, 1st
viscount Bolingbroke (1678-1751);
Abigail (Hill) Masham, Lady Masham
(d.1734).
110/I/ 2,4-87

did.unittitle: MARTIN, E.
Letter (copy) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Hammersmith
1 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Letter of thanks.
110/II/211

did.unittitle: OXFORD, ROBERT HARLEY, 1ST EARL OF, 1661-1724
Letter (copy) to Sophie, Electress of Hanover, Consort of Ernest Augustus, Elector of Hanover, (1630-1714)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
2 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
Assures her that the Anne, queen of
Gt. Brit. (1665-1714), favors the
succession of her family.
110/I/93

did.unittitle: PEMBROKE, MARY (HOWE) HERBERT, COUNTESS OF, D.1749
22 letters (copies) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

n.p.

did.unittitle: POMFRET, HENRIETTA LOUISA FERMOR, COUNTESS OF, D.1761

did.unittitle: SUNDERLAND, ANNE (CHURCHILL) SPENCER, COUNTESS OF, 1683-1716
Letter (copy) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Salisbury

did.unittitle: VOLTAIRE, FRANCOIS MARIE AROUET DE, 1694-1778
Letter (copy) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.

did.unittitle: WAINWRIGHT, J
23 letters (copies) to Charlotte (Dyve) Clayton, Lady Sundon (d.1742)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1729 Jan 17 - 1732 Dec 26
Dublin
27 p.; 38 x 24 cm.
About politics, religion, and legal
matters between client and lawyer;
also concerns Wainwright's attempts
at poetry and drama; mentions Robert
Clayton, bp. of Clogher (1695-1758),
and Robert Walpole, 1st earl of
Orford, 1676-1745.
110/II/288-311
